title: Domain structure of proteins set member 4

content.question: Which of the following best models the interaction of protein <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and protein <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>II</mi></math> that results in the transcription of target genes?

choices.label: The figure shows a model of the interactions between protein 1 and protein 2 and D N A. The D N A is represented with a horizontal line. An arrow labeled Transcription is positioned on the D N A line about one-third of the way from the left end of the line. The arrow has a 90 degree bend so that it points upward from the D N A line and then to the right. Protein 1 is represented by an oval oriented vertically so that its F half touches the D N A line close to the left end of the line and to the left of the transcription arrow, and the G half makes no contact with the D N A. Protein 2 is represented by a rectangle oriented horizontally slightly above and to the right of protein 1. Neither the L nor the M halves of Protein 2 touch Protein I or the D N A.

The figure shows a model of the interactions between protein 1 and protein 2 and D N A. The D N A is represented with a horizontal line. An arrow labeled Transcription is positioned on the D N A line about one-third of the way from the left end of the line. The arrow has a 90 degree bend so that it points upward from the D N A line and then to the right. Protein 1 is represented by an oval oriented vertically so that its F half touches the D N A line close to the left end of the line and to the left of the transcription arrow, and the G half makes no contact with the D N A. Protein 2 is represented by a rectangle positioned such that the M half of Protein 2 touches the G half of Protein 1. The L half of Protein 2 does not touch Protein 1 or the D N A.

The figure shows a model of the interactions between protein 1 and protein 2 and D N A. The D N A is represented with a horizontal line. An arrow labeled Transcription is positioned on the D N A line about one-third of the way from the left end of the line. The arrow has a 90 degree bend so that it points upward from the D N A line and then to the right. Protein 1 is represented by an oval oriented vertically so that its F half touches the D N A line close to the left end of the line and to the left of the transcription arrow, and the G half makes no contact with the D N A. Protein 2 is represented by a rectangle oriented vertically between Protein 1 and the Transcription arrow. The L half of Protein 2 touches the D N A line, and the M half makes no contact with the D N A. The two proteins do not touch each other.

The figure shows a model of the interactions between protein 1 and protein 2 and D N A. The D N A is represented with a horizontal line. An arrow labeled Transcription is positioned on the D N A line about one-third of the way from the left end of the line. The arrow has a 90 degree bend so that it points upward from the D N A line and then to the right. Protein 2 is represented by a rectangle oriented vertically so that its L half touches the D N A line and to the left of the transcription arrow, and the M half makes no contact with the D N A. Protein 1 is represented by an oval positioned such that the F half of Protein 1 touches the M half of Protein 2. The G half of Protein 1 does not touch Protein 2 or the D N A.

content.answer: The figure shows a model of the interactions between protein 1 and protein 2 and D N A. The D N A is represented with a horizontal line. An arrow labeled Transcription is positioned on the D N A line about one-third of the way from the left end of the line. The arrow has a 90 degree bend so that it points upward from the D N A line and then to the right. Protein 1 is represented by an oval oriented vertically so that its F half touches the D N A line close to the left end of the line and to the left of the transcription arrow, and the G half makes no contact with the D N A. Protein 2 is represented by a rectangle positioned such that the M half of Protein 2 touches the G half of Protein 1. The L half of Protein 2 does not touch Protein 1 or the D N A.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
